data.title: San Francisco Public Press
data.meta_description: KSFP-LP, Our FM Radio Station - San Francisco Public Press
data.text:
Streaming 24 hours a day:

KSFP is a low-power community radio station, launched in August 2019, offering a mix of original local and national talk radio including news, public affairs and storytelling programs.

KSFP broadcasts on 102.5 FM from Sutro Tower, between 4 and 10 a.m., and between 4 and 10 p.m, seven days a week. At other times you can hear KXSF, another station operated on the same frequency by San Francisco Community Radio, which specializes in independently produced music and culture programming.

“Civic” from the San Francisco Public Press

KSFP’s marquee weekly public-affairs show, “Civic,” is hosted produced by Mel Baker and Liana Wilcox. New episodes of “Civic” air Thursdays at 6 p.m. Part talk show, part field reporting, the program delves into topics in the news and unpacks past and current Public Press investigative reporting.

Other programs

PRX Remix from the Public Radio Exchange.

Various times.

“The California Report” from KQED Public Broadcasting.

Mondays at 8:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m.

“Bioneers Radio” from Bioneers.

Wednesdays at 8 a.m. and 6 p.m.

“Making Contact” from the National Radio Project.

Fridays at 8 a.m. and 6 p.m.

“Education Beat” from EdSource.

Tuesdays at 8:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. “Out in the Bay” Queer Radio from San Francisco.

Thursdays at 8:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. and Saturdays at 9:30 a.m.

“Voices of the Community” by George Koster.

Wednesdays at 8:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. “News in Context” by Gina Baleria.

Mondays and Fridays at 8:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m.

Open Studio

We curate additional local podcasts and other audio programming in blocks of shows on KSFP’s “Open Studio” Monday through Friday at 9 a.m. and 7 p.m. Shows include:

“Radio Teco” from El Tecolote covers Latinx news and culture in San Francisco.

Tuesdays at 9 a.m. and 7 p.m.

Women’s Soccer Show is a locally produced podcast that covers women’s soccer in the U.S. and worldwide.

Thursdays at 9 a.m. and 7 p.m.

“This is 30” is a podcast about living in San Francisco in your 30s.

Thursdays at 9:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m.

“The California Sun Podcast”

Fridays at 9 a.m. and 7 p.m.

Walter Thompson hosts “The Golden City,” a podcast that presents stories from San Francisco’s past, present and future.

Fridays at 9:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m.

Supporters

This project was made possible by financial support from hundreds of Public Press members, and from generous grants from the James Irvine Foundation, the California Endowment and the Ethics and Excellence in Journalism Foundation, among other institutional supporters.

If you are interested in learning more or want to participate, send an email to radio [at] sfpublicpress [dot] org.
